page.title: 20CREDITS
page.content: The Domesday survey was carried out by two classes of 3rd year children and two classes of 4th year children.Small parties of between 10 and 15 pupils were taken out either on foot or in the school minibus and given various tasks of counting,interviewing and observing. Amongst those people who helped us were the Vicar of Horninglow, the Minister of St.Thomas's and Anslow Chapels, the heads of various schools, the hospital administrator, farmers and members of the childrens families.The survey was carried out over a period of six weeks. The text was written, edited and fed into the computer by a group of 4th. year boys.Displays of written work, drawings, charts and maps which have been used in the survey are now on display in the school.
